channel.title: Absolute newbie needing help with Image matching script
channel.description:
Hey (:
So I just learned about what SCAR is and what it can do, and I'm looking to write my own script which matches images from Neopets for the Mystery Pic competition. I would like to know a few things, if anyone could be kind enough to explain to me:
1) How does SCAR find an image? Like, do I select the browser where Neopets is loaded at to run the script or...? 2) What must I do to write a fully functional script like that? (eg. compile a database of Neopets images, etc.)
Much thanks in advance to those who help me out. (:

item.title: Absolute newbie needing help with Image matching script
item.dc:creator: @FrostFyr FrostFÿr
item.description:
@FrostFyr wrote:

then find what layers those bitmaps connect to and how it’ll cover the others, gawd.

Read full topic
item.source: Absolute newbie needing help with Image matching script

item.title: Absolute newbie needing help with Image matching script
item.dc:creator: @script_owned script_owned
item.description:
@script_owned wrote:

No actually this is pretty easy just get maybe alot of bitmaps of the neopets and use the findbitmap function to find those bitmaps.

Read full topic
item.source: Absolute newbie needing help with Image matching script

item.title: Absolute newbie needing help with Image matching script
item.dc:creator: @FrostFyr FrostFÿr
item.description:
@FrostFyr wrote:

You’d need a complete image database, what areas each of those items cover, then some very complex stuff to make it find what the mystery neopet looked like and with what items, pretty hard job.

Read full topic
item.source: Absolute newbie needing help with Image matching script
